channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Investors Are Jittery as G.O.P. Bill Threatens to Swell Deficit
item.description: Investors burned by President Trump’s trade fight now have to contend with a spending megabill that risks swelling the federal deficit.

item.title: Musk says he’s committed to being Tesla CEO for next five years
item.description: The Tesla head previously complained of 'great difficulty' jugging his CEO and government advisor jobs.

item.title: Israel’s Allies Denounce Its New Gaza Offensive
item.description: Britain, France and Canada, all powerful supporters of Israel, called plans for an escalation of the Gaza war “disproportionate” and “egregious.”

item.title: Meet the 10 CFOs on Fortune’s 2025 Most Powerful Women in business list
item.description: The list features 100 leading businesswomen from finance, tech, health care, telecom, retail, energy, and other industries.

item.title: Rep. McIver Charged With Assault Over Clash Outside Newark ICE Center
item.description: The Department of Justice also announced it was dropping a trespass charge against the city’s mayor stemming from the same episode.

item.title: Ukrainians Brace for a Longer War as Trump Backs Off Cease-Fire Call
item.description: President Trump appears to be stepping back from trying to end the war in Ukraine. Many in the country see little choice but to battle on.

item.title: World Economic Forum says it will take 100 years to achieve global gender parity—investment titan Lubna Olayan says we ‘cannot afford’ to wait that long
item.description: Lubna Olayan, an investment titan in Saudi Arabia, says research which shows it will take 100 years to achieve gender parity on a global scale must be...

item.title: Not just ‘slash and burn’—the real reason this major pharmaceutical company ousted 40% of its middle managers
item.description: In an effort to become more nimble, some companies, like Bayer Pharmaceutical, are getting rid of middle managers.

item.title: Fortune’s 2025 Most Powerful Women list is here
item.description: The annual ranking of the women leading global business is more competitive than ever.

item.title: What Did the Democrats Know, and When Did They Know It?
item.description: This is not an idle question. The future of the party depends on answering it.

item.title: Trump-Putin Call Notches Diplomatic Win for Russia, but Economic Goals Remain in Limbo
item.description: The Kremlin has withstood pressure for an immediate cease-fire as a precondition for peace talks, but the Russian president’s push for normalizing rel...

item.title: Ukrainians Brace for a Longer War as Trump Backs Off Cease-Fire Call
item.description: President Trump appears to be stepping back from trying to end the war in Ukraine. Many in the country see little choice but to battle on.

item.title: Telefonica Outage in Spain Knocks Out Emergency Lines
item.description: The outage Tuesday knocked out emergency phone lines in several parts of the country for several hours.

item.title: Israel’s Allies Denounce Its New Gaza Offensive
item.description: Britain, France and Canada, all powerful supporters of Israel, called plans for an escalation of the Gaza war “disproportionate” and “egregious.”

item.title: Trump Backs Off His Demand That Russia Declare a Cease-Fire in Ukraine
item.description: President Trump once vowed to broker peace between Russia and Ukraine in 24 hours. Now he says the two sides should work it out themselves.
